Felipe Miguel Pait

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/0722519952707493
  • Última atualização do currículo em 17/06/2019

Felipe Pait was born in São Paulo, Brazil, in 1963. He learned Euclid from Reinaldo Rizzo and Amadeu Z Matsumura, and probabilities at home. He received a bachelor's degree in electrical engineering from the University of São Paulo in 1985, and a PhD from Yale University in 1993, where he did research on adaptive control advised by A S Morse. Between 1985 and 1987 he worked in the development of real time control systems. He is a Privatdozent in the Laboratory of Automation and Control, University of Sao Paulo. From 2002 until 2004 he was with Alphatech, Inc., Burlington, Massachusetts, working on development of algorithms for tracking, sensor fusion, and cooperative control. His professional interests include adaptive control, Riemannian geometric methods in control theory, mathematical foundations of data science, and klezmer. He writes about themes related to his studies and on current affairs in various channels, and has recently studied the Lur'e problem, derivative-free optimization, and Filippov solutions to the two-body problem. (Texto informado pelo autor)
